Package gerberFileReader

Class ApertureTransformation

  • java.lang.Object
    • gerberFileReader.ApertureTransformation
  • public class ApertureTransformation
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to hold geometric transformations of an aperture
    See Also:
    Section 4.9 of the Gerber Layer Format Specification

    • Method Detail

      • set

        public void set​(java.lang.String command)
         throws GerberLayerFormatException
        Sets the state of the aperture transformations
        Parameters:
        command - - one of the Gerber commands: LP - Load Polarity, LM - Load Mirror, LR - Load Rotation, or LS - Load Scale
        Throws:
        GerberLayerFormatException - if the given command is not valid

      • getPolarity

        public Polarity getPolarity()
        Returns:
        the current polarity state

      • getApertureTransform

        public java.awt.geom.AffineTransform getApertureTransform()
        Returns:
        the current scaling, mirroring, and rotation states combined as a single Affine transform

      • getRotation

        public double getRotation()
        Returns:
        the current rotation state (in degrees)

      • getScale

        public double getScale()
        Returns:
        the current scaling state

      • isMirrorX

        public boolean isMirrorX()
        Returns:
        true if the current mirror state is set to mirror in the X direction, false otherwise

      • isMirrorY

        public boolean isMirrorY()
        Returns:
        true if the current mirror state is set to mirror in the Y direction, false otherwise

      • apply

        public GraphicalObject apply​(Point translation,
                             GraphicalObject graphicObject,
                             AttributeDictionary attributes)
        Creates a new GraphicObject by applying this ApertureTransformation to the specified GraphicObject. A copy of the specified object is mirrored, scaled, rotated (in that order), and its polarity is reversed if the current polarity state is Clear. Finally, the copy is translated by the specified amount. All attributes attached to the original object are copied to the new object and any object attributes in the specified attribute dictionary are attached to the new object as well.
        Parameters:
        translation - - the amount to translate the transformed object
        graphicObject - - the object to copy and transform
        attributes - - the attribute dictionary whose object attributes are to be attached to the new object
        Returns:
        the new GraphicsObject

      • apply

        public GraphicsStream apply​(Point translation,
                            Aperture aperture,
                            AttributeDictionary attributes)
        Creates a new GraphicStream of by applying this ApertureTransformation to the specified Aperture. A copy of the aperture is created and all objects of that copy are mirrored, scaled, rotated (in that order), and have their polarity reversed if the current polarity state is Clear. Finally, the copies are translated by the specified amount. All attributes attached to the original aperture are copied to the new objects and any object attributes in the specified attribute dictionary are attached to each new object as well.
        Parameters:
        translation - - the amount to translate each transformed object
        aperture - - the aperture to copy and transform
        attributes - - the attribute dictionary whose object attributes are to be attached to the new objects
        Returns:
        the new GraphicStream containing all of the created objects
